post: Secondary educators - you're invited to join the Bill of Rights Institute (BRI) for an in-person professional development seminar focused on enriching social studies instruction through the lens of freedom and civic responsibility. Participants will explore how foundational American principles and historical moments can be made accessible and meaningful for secondary students. Teachers will collaborate with one another and with BRI staff to build lesson ideas that are both engaging and aligned with standards. Participants will receive: - breakfast and lunch during the programming - a certificate for 6 contact hours - a chance to network with fellow teachers - Overnight accommodations will be provided for the first 10 registrants. All additional participants will have access to a discounted hotel rate. Register today!  https://bit.ly/4cZv8tt

Calling all student entrepreneurs and change makers in the St. Louis area! BRI's civic engagement contest is open to all Missouri-based young people who are between the ages of 13 and 19. All Missouri-based applicants to the national competition will be invited to exhibit their projects in-person on May 19th, 2025 at the MyImpact Challenge Missouri Fair. Students will have the opportunity to showcase their work and enter to win up to $2,000 at the Missouri Contest and eligible applications will automatically be entered for a chance to win a $10,000 national prize! Register Today!  https://bit.ly/4jYjfX5

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Jonah Horwitz! He is a senior at Dunwoody High School in Atlanta. He serves as National Honor Society President, Model UN President, and DECA Vice President and is the Chief Finance Officer of the Junior Economic Club of Atlanta, is a varsity swimmer, and placed 4th in the National Personal Finance Challenge. Learn more about the Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h.

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Naomi Obasa! She is a senior in the International Baccalaureate Diploma Program at Bay Shore High School in Bay Shore, New York. She is involved in clubs like Model UN, Student Council, and Brothers and Sisters Organization. This is her second year participating in the Bill of Rights fellowship and she is excited to learn even more about civics! Learn more about the Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Our MyImpact Challenge contest deadline is approaching! The contest is open until May 18, 2025, 11:59 pm. MyImpact Challenge is a nationwide civic engagement contest open to students ages 13-19. The contest highlights students actively engaged in service, volunteerism, or entrepreneurship in their communities. All complete applications are judged and winners are awarded cash prizes! Students start your profile today!  https://bit.ly/4lKiFho

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Irene Xu! Irene is a junior at the Early College at Guilford in North Carolina. She actively contributes to her school community, serving on the boards of the Student Council, Math Club, Code Club, and EducateUS. She is interested in mathematics, literature, and history/civics and some of her hobbies include figure skating, photography, and baking. Learn more about the Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h.

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Irene Xu! Irene Xu is a junior at the Early College at Guilford in North Carolina. She actively contributes to her school community, serving on the boards of the Student Council, Math Club, Code Club, and EducateUS. She is interested in mathematics, literature, and history/civics and some of her hobbies include figure skating, photography, and baking. BRIs Student Fellowship is a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. Learn more about our Student Fellowship!  https://lnkd.in/eu9r_8eR.

#OTD 250 years ago, Paul Revere warned the countryside that British troops moved to seize colonial arms in Concord, Massachusetts. Acting in urgency, Revere's ride demonstrated an expression of self-governance and responsibility. Paul Revere's ride captures the distinctly American spirit of citizens rising to protect their rights when need be. Explore all of our Celebrating America 250 resources!  https://bit.ly/3Ga5w0Q

Attention Social Studies Teachers! Are you looking for new ways to engage your students? BRI's Senior Director of Programs, Joe Schmidt and co-author Glenn Wiebe have published The Social Studies FIELD Guide  to help you transform your classroom. This book offers innovative strategies to emphasize active learning, integrate primary sources, and use educational technology effectively. Discover the FIELD theoryFoundational evidence, Inquiry, Educational technology, and Lesson Designto create an engaging and effective learning environment. Learn more and find out how to get a copy of the book in our recent blog post.  https://bit.ly/4jzA0rp

Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Maya Dombroskie! Maya will be joining Dartmouth College's class of 2029, majoring in Quantitative Social Sciences with minors in Public Policy and Linguistics. A passionate believer in creating local solutions to national political issues, she's proud to have worked with Students Demand Action and her school board to spread awareness about safe gun storage, Schlow Centre Region Library to increase funding for PA's libraries, and her school's Speech and Debate team to provide low-cost educational childcare in her community. BRIs Student Fellowship is a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. Visit  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h to learn more!
